physical_appearance: This is a wooden incense stick holder. It is cylindrical in shape, with a wide circular base. On the body, there is a carving of a dragon. The dragon is gilded in gold. The gilding is faded especially around the head of the dragon.
sgcool_label_text:
This is a heavy wooden incense stick holder with a dragon carved wrapped around the body of it. The dragon is gilded and the holder is also decorated with a Chinese key fret pattern band running around it.

This item is donated by the family of prominent Peranakan, Ong Sam Leong (b. 1857, Singapore â€“ d. 7 February 1918, Singapore). It comes from his ancestral home of Bukit Rose, formerly at 259 Bukit Timah Road. Ong was a well-known successful businessman who made is money in the mining of phosphate on Christmas island, which was historically a territory of colonial Singapore.
subject_terms_1: dragons Religious ceremonies ceremonial objects incense sticks Peranakan
subject_terms_2: Incense burners and containers Rites and ceremonies Dragons Ceremonial objects Peranakan (Asian people)
